page.title: 12Delph 3
page.content: Some of the old mills have been {converted to other uses,}such as the Compoflex firm which produces flexible plastic hoses. Delph's rail link has long been severed and the{old station}is now a physiotherapist's clinic and in the station yard there is a plant hire contractor and mountains of crushed rock salt used by Oldham M.B.C. Highways Department on the winter roads. The{centre of the village}contains most of the{shops and services}that are needed for everyday use. There are also several craft shops, cafes and 'olde worlde' pubs which cater for the tourists who come to see this pretty village and take walks in the upper Tame valley.
